id.title: Unique ID
id.description: An string that uniquely identifies this webhook.

url.title: URL
url.description: A valid URL for the Webhook.

events.title: Events
events.description: The events that can trigger the webhook and whether they are enabled.

subscribe.title: Subscribed
subscribe.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a list subscriber is added.

unsubscribe.title: Unsubscribed
unsubscribe.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a list member unsubscribes.

profile.title: Profile Updated
profile.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a subscriber's profile is updated.

cleaned.title: Cleaned
cleaned.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a subscriber's email address is cleaned from the list.

upemail.title: Email Address Updated
upemail.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a subscriber's email address is changed.

campaign.title: Campaign Sent
campaign.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a campaign is sent or cancelled.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: The possible sources of any events that can trigger the webhook and whether they are enabled.

user.title: User
user.description: Whether the webhook is triggered by subscriber-initiated actions.

admin.title: Admin
admin.description: Whether the webhook is triggered by admin-initiated actions in the web interface.

api.title: API
api.description: Whether the webhook is triggered by actions initiated via the API.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique id for the list.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.
